title.narrative: OUTPUT 7:Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) COMMUNITY INFRASTRUCTURE

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) community infrastructure strengthened, ensuring improved access to and quality of services to children, families and communities, especially in disadvantaged areas, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, UNICEF contributed to Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector performance ensuring effective coverage of safe drinking water, improved knowledge, sanitation services and practices in most disadvantaged areas and healthy environment promoted

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)

Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, WASH community infrastructure strengthened, ensuring improved access to and quality of services to children,families and communities, especially in disadvantaged areas

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened WASH community infrastructure ensuring improved access for more than 6,500 families to water supply and 1,600 families to sanitation facilities in seven conflict-affected/border districts. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2018
